title: Dual system(Win10+Ubuntu20.04)
content:
Install Ubuntu20.04 system in my computer, where window10 has been installed.

SSD(120G)+HDD(1T)

Conditions:

  1. Dell optiplex3060

  2. SSD(120G)+HDD(1T)

  3. Windows10(installed)

  4. UEFI+GPT(New technology)

    (differences:

    boot by UEFI, your pc need a EFI partition(not /boot), while boot by legacy, you will need a /boot partition

    )

​ If you want the computer will list boot options after you turn on it, you’d better put both window10 and ubuntu’s “boot or efi” in a same disk. My window10 is installed in ssd, so I compressed volume from the ssd(actually is C: disk), about 400MB. It will contain ubuntu’s efi partition.

Prerequisites:

  1. USB flash disk >= 8G
  2. Ubuntu20.04xxxxxxx.iso
  3. UtraISO(recommended), the way of write(USB-ZIP+)
  4. A USB flash disk which contains ubuntu20.04

Step by Step:

  1. Untick your pc’s quick start(this setting can be changed in battery option)

  2. Compressed volume from the ssd(actually is C: disk), about 400MB. It will contain ubuntu’s efi partition.

  3. Restart your computer, press F2(dell), get in the bios, and turn off the security boot(just make it disabled), at the same time, turn off legacy.(choose UEFI)

  4. (Important)turn off “RAID ON”, and change it to “ACHI”(bios->Sata operation).

    (ps:

    ​ Because “RAID ON” is default setting on a dell computer, If you not do like this, your computer may can’t recognize ssd. What’s worse, you can’t install ubuntu system and get a warning

    )

  5. Partition:

    In Windows, there is C disk, D disk, E disk, accordingly, in ubuntu, there is sda1, sda2, sda3, sdb1, sdb2,…(sda is a disk, while sdb is another disk, don’t mix them up).

    partition file of type size priority position
    EFI efi partition 400MB primary ssd
    / ext4 40GB primary hdd
    /home ext4 50GB logical hdd
    swap swap space 16GB primary hdd

    For speed the process of turn on computer, I will choose the partition of ‘efi’ as boot but default.

    waiting…

    After it, if you can’t get in your window10, just reset your computer,[important] don’t choose delete everything.
